org.asterope.healpix
Class PixToolsUtils

  org.asterope.healpix.PixToolsUtils

public class PixToolsUtils
extends java.lang.Object

various utilities not directly related to Healpix.

Constructor Summary
PixToolsUtils()
           
 
Method Summary
static double[] intrs_intrv(double[] d1, double[] d2)
          computes the intersection di of 2 intervals d1 (= [a1,b1]) and d2 (= [a2,b2]) on the periodic domain (=[A,B] where A and B arbitrary) ni is the resulting number of intervals (0,1, or 2) if a1 b1 then d1 = {x | a1 <=x <= B U A <=x <=b1}
static double[] PolarToRaDec(double[] polar)
          returns ra, dec in degrees given polar coordinates in radians
static double[] RaDecToPolar(double[] radec)
          returns polar coordinates in radians given ra, dec in degrees
static double SurfaceTriangle(PixToolsVector3d v1, PixToolsVector3d v2, PixToolsVector3d v3)
          calculates the surface of spherical triangle defined by vertices v1,v2,v3 Algorithm: finds triangle sides and uses l'Huilier formula to compute "spherical excess" = surface area of triangle on a sphere of radius one see, eg Bronshtein, Semendyayev Eq 2.86 half perimeter hp = 0.5*(side1+side2+side3) l'Huilier formula x0 = tan( hp/2.) x1 = tan((hp - side1)/2.) x2 = tan((hp - side2)/2.) x3 = tan((hp - side3)/2.)
static double[] Vect2Ang(PixToolsVector3d v)
          converts a PixToolsVector3d in a tuple of angles tup[0] = theta co-latitude measured from North pole, in [0,PI] radians, tup[1] = phi longitude measured eastward, in [0,2PI] radians
static double[] xyzToPolar(double x, double y, double z)
          returns polar coordinates of a point on unit sphere given Cartesian coordinates

Method Detail

SurfaceTriangle

public static double SurfaceTriangle(PixToolsVector3d v1,
                                     PixToolsVector3d v2,
                                     PixToolsVector3d v3)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
calculates the surface of spherical triangle defined by vertices v1,v2,v3 Algorithm: finds triangle sides and uses l'Huilier formula to compute "spherical excess" = surface area of triangle on a sphere of radius one see, eg Bronshtein, Semendyayev Eq 2.86 half perimeter hp = 0.5*(side1+side2+side3) l'Huilier formula x0 = tan( hp/2.) x1 = tan((hp - side1)/2.) x2 = tan((hp - side2)/2.) x3 = tan((hp - side3)/2.)

Parameters:
v1 - PixToolsVector3d
v2 - PixToolsVector3d
v3 - PixToolsVector3d vertices of the triangle
Returns:
double the triangle surface
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

RaDecToPolar

public static double[] RaDecToPolar(double[] radec)
returns polar coordinates in radians given ra, dec in degrees

Parameters:
radec - double array containing ra,dec in degrees
Returns:
res double array containing theta and phi in radians res[0] = theta res[1] = phi

PolarToRaDec

public static double[] PolarToRaDec(double[] polar)
returns ra, dec in degrees given polar coordinates in radians

Parameters:
polar - double array polar[0] = phi in radians polar[1] = theta in radians
Returns:
double array radec radec[0] = ra in degrees radec[1] = dec in degrees

xyzToPolar

public static double[] xyzToPolar(double x,
                                  double y,
                                  double z)
returns polar coordinates of a point on unit sphere given Cartesian coordinates

Parameters:
x - - Cartesian coordinate x of a point on unit sphere
y - - y coordinate
z - - z coordinate
Returns:
double [] theta,phi

Vect2Ang

public static double[] Vect2Ang(PixToolsVector3d v)
converts a PixToolsVector3d in a tuple of angles tup[0] = theta co-latitude measured from North pole, in [0,PI] radians, tup[1] = phi longitude measured eastward, in [0,2PI] radians

Parameters:
v - PixToolsVector3d
Returns:
double[] out_tup out_tup[0] = theta out_tup[1] = phi

intrs_intrv

public static double[] intrs_intrv(double[] d1,
                                   double[] d2)
computes the intersection di of 2 intervals d1 (= [a1,b1]) and d2 (= [a2,b2]) on the periodic domain (=[A,B] where A and B arbitrary) ni is the resulting number of intervals (0,1, or 2) if a1 b1 then d1 = {x | a1 <=x <= B U A <=x <=b1}

Parameters:
d1 - double[] first interval
d2 - double[] second interval
Returns:
double[] one or two intervals intersections
